subject: Re: [junit] testing flat file data
msgSnippet: I don t think he meant for _you_ to open the file.  Add code to the test case that opens the log file and compares the last line in the file with what you
messageBody:
I don't think he meant for _you_ to open the file.  Add code to the test case that opens the log file and compares the last line in the file with what you logged.

Larry

Bhavaniprasad Polimetla wrote:

Dear sir,

If I am opening the log file and checking the values, it becomes the manual process.
I would like to automate the process. After executing the test simply it need to show test pass or fail. How can I automate this situation?
Regards,
Bhavani.
 

David Roussel wrote:

In my log test I added an extra method, getLogCount() that returns the number of lines logged.  I then log different lines at various log levels (trace, info, warn, fatal), and then assert that the correct number of lines have been written.If you want to validate the log formatting, then redirect your output to a StringWriter then use a regular expression library to validate the string.Dave
-----Original Message-----
From: Bhavaniprasad Polimetla [mailto:bhavaniprasad.polimetla@...]
Sent: 21 May 2001 12:25
To: junit
Subject: [junit] testing flat file data
Dear sir,

I am testing "log" function.
It will write the data into predefined flat file. It wont return any
values.
Ex:
_errLog.log("testing error log.log");

How can I write the test?

Regards,
Bhavani.
